NOS CUIDAMOS
↕ Vertical Spacer ↕
Estamos unidos para hacer del mundo un lugar mejor.
Creemos que todos merecen una vida más saludable. Lideramos con empatía, respeto y gratitud. Actuamos con integridad, haciendo las cosas de la manera correcta, por las razones correctas, sin importar lo que pase. Apoyamos a los demás compartiendo generosamente nuestros recursos y talentos. Trabajamos todos los días para ganarnos la confianza de todas nuestras partes interesadas.

SOMOS INCLUSIVOS
↕ Vertical Spacer ↕
Creamos un sentido de pertenencia para todos.
Cultivamos un entorno en el que las personas puedan ser auténticas. Fomentamos una cultura de pertenencia en la que todos se sientan valorados, parte de un equipo global y empoderados para hacer cosas extraordinarias. Diseñamos las mejores soluciones acogiendo los talentos, las perspectivas y los antecedentes únicos de nuestra diversa fuerza laboral. Formamos los equipos más fuertes y creamos caminos poderosos para nuestra gente y nuestras comunidades que rompen las barreras diarias para la equidad de oportunidades.

TENEMOS VALENTÍA
↕ Vertical Spacer ↕
Impulsamos el cambio y hacemos que las cosas sucedan.
Pensamos en grande. Somos infinitamente curiosos y buscamos constantemente mejores formas de trabajar. Nos desafiamos unos a otros y a nuestra forma de hacer las cosas, sin miedo a alterar el statu quo, innovando, explorando y alcanzando lo que es posible de manera audaz e intencional. Reconocemos que para crecer y prosperar debemos aprovechar el poder que nos proporciona nuestro legado, escala y alcance para el bien y para todos.

Read more about how we bring this value to life. Our Commitmentto Inclusion Embracing diverse voices and fostering an inclusive work environment isn’t just something we do; it’s embedded into the company, reflecting who we are, what we value and how we think. Inclusion guides our daily work, empowering our people to achieve their potential and positively impact the business, enabling us to better serve our communities. Our Values By living our Colgate Values of Caring, Inclusive and Courageous, we create a culture in which people act as a team, working together toward common goals. These values guide our actions, shape our decisions, and inspire us to reimagine a healthier future for all. We believe that when we embrace our unique talents, perspectives, and backgrounds, we can solve the toughest problems and create the best solutions. Who We Are We are Caring We are united in making the world a better place. Our actions are guided by empathy, respect, and genuine gratitude. Integrity drives our decisions—doing things the right way, for the right reasons, regardless of circumstances. Everyone deserves access to a healthier life. We are Inclusive We create a sense of belonging for all and cultivate an environment where people can be their authentic selves. We foster a culture of belonging where CP People feel valued, part of a global team, and empowered to do extraordinary things. We design the best solutions by embracing the unique talents, perspectives and backgrounds of our global workforce. We are Courageous We are infinitely curious, constantly searching for better ways of working. Challenging each other comes naturally, fearlessly disrupting the status quo through bold innovation. We recognize that to grow and thrive we must build on the power of our legacy, our scale, and reach for good and for all. A Strategic Differentiator At Colgate-Palmolive, diverse perspectives accelerate our growth. People We fuel sustainable growth by building a global talent pipeline with diverse backgrounds and perspectives. We achieve this by developing our people through meaningful experiences, cultivating a high-impact, inclusive culture where all voices drive innovation, and advancing next-gen enterprise capabilities as a competitive advantage. Culture We cultivate a globally inclusive workplace where every voice matters, empowering all employees to thrive through impactful contributions and rewarding growth. We harness the power of inclusion for collective success by fostering a deep sense of belonging rooted in our values and purpose to reimagine a healthier future for all. Business and Community Impact We actively build a global and varied network of talent and partners, leveraging high-performing teams for growth and innovation. As owners of some of the world's most penetrated brands, we nurture authentic relationships and meaningful partnerships with suppliers, customers, consumers and our communities, driving growth, trust, and shared opportunity. Noel Wallace*
Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer
Noel Wallace became President and Chief Executive Officer in 2019 and Chairman in 2020. He previously served as President and Chief Operating Officer from 2018 to 2019, responsible for all of the Company’s operating units worldwide. He joined Colgate-Palmolive in 1987 and progressed through a series of senior management roles around the world. He became President, Colgate North America and Global Sustainability in 2010, President, Colgate Latin America in 2013 and Chief Operating Officer, Global Innovation & Growth and Hill’s Pet Nutrition in 2016.

Stanley J. Sutula III*
Chief Finance Officer
Stan Sutula is Chief Finance Officer, overseeing the Company’s Global Finance, Global Information Technology, and Mergers & Acquisitions teams. Stan joined Colgate-Palmolive in 2020 from Pitney Bowes Inc., where he served as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer. Stan has extensive experience in corporate finance, financial planning and operations, tax, strategic planning and risk management. He previously spent 28 years at IBM Corporation in financial management roles of increasing responsibility, culminating in service as IBM’s Vice President and Controller. Stan graduated from Northeastern University and holds an MBA in Finance from Fordham University’s Gabelli School of Business.

Jennifer M. Daniels*
Chief Legal Officer and Secretary
Jennifer Daniels joined Colgate in 2014 as Chief Legal Officer and Secretary. Jennifer brings extensive corporate governance and legal experience to her role. Prior to Colgate, she served as Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary of NCR Corporation. Before joining NCR in 2010, she was Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary of Barnes & Noble, Inc. Previously, Jennifer spent nearly 17 years at IBM, progressing through increasingly senior roles including Vice President, Assistant General Counsel, Chief Trust and Compliance Officer. Jennifer graduated from the University of Pennsylvania and Harvard Law School.

Chief Operating Officer, Americas
Shane Grant joined Colgate-Palmolive in 2025 as Chief Operating Officer, America, overseeing the North America and Latin America regions.. Prior to joining the Company Shane was Group Deputy CEO, CEO Americas and EVP Dairy, Plant-Based and Global Sales at Danone. Previously, Shane spent nearly 20 years with The Coca-Cola Company, where he held various leadership roles of increasing responsibility in category leadership, commercial and general management. He holds degrees in business and arts from the University of Auckland.

Chief Growth Officer
John Hazlin became Chief Growth Officer in 2025, where he is responsible for leading the implementation of the CP 2030 Strategic Plan, including initiatives focused on enterprise transformation and peer-leading capabilities. He is also responsible for setting direction for our global categories and for the global growth functions, including Analytics, Design, Digital, Research & Development and Supply Chain. John was previously President of the Company’s Hill’s Pet Nutrition business. Prior to this, John was President, Africa/Eurasia, where he expanded the Company’s presence in the region by championing commercial prioritization and driving innovation and digital commerce. John joined Colgate-Palmolive in 1997 as part of the Global Marketing Development Program after completing a CP internship in 1996. John graduated from Duke University and holds an MBA from New York University.

Previously, Panos served as Group President, Europe and Developing Markets, leading the European Division in addition to Latin America, Asia Pacific and Africa/Eurasia. Chief Communications Officer
Dana Bolden joined Colgate-Palmolive in 2025 as the Chief Communications Officer, bringing more than three decades of experience to the role. Prior to joining the Company, he served as Senior Vice President, Corporate Affairs at Haleon, where he directed all external and internal corporate communications and played a key role in creating the corporate brand. Prior to Haleon, Dana served as Senior Vice President, External Affairs and Sustainability at Corteva Agriscience where he led the creation of the corporate brand. President, Africa/Eurasia
Maria Paula Capuzzo became President, Africa/Eurasia in 2022. Since 2019, Maria Paula has been Vice President and General Manager, C-P Brazil where she has helped drive consistently strong sales growth. With One Brazil as the focus, she elevated the digital and commercial capabilities while championing our F.E.E.D. principles and DE&I.  Prior to her time in Brazil, Maria Paula was General Manager, Guatemala and held senior positions in the Latin America Division. President, Asia Pacific
Mukul Deoras became President, Asia Pacific, in 2018, a role he knows well having first held the position from 2012 to 2015. In between, Mukul served as Colgate’s Chief Marketing Officer where he drove renewed focus on our brands through the development of our Brand Purpose Models and a series of business-strengthening and capability-building initiatives. He joined Colgate in 2004 after two decades rising through the ranks of Unilever India. His work across multiple geographies in marketing and general management roles led our business to significant sales and profit growth sustained by a robust innovation pipeline. Chief Investor Relations Officer and EVP, M&A
John Faucher became Chief Investor Relations Officer and EVP, M&A in 2019. He joined Colgate in 2016 as Senior Vice President, Investor Relations, responsible for communicating our business results and strategies to investors, analysts and media. John brings extensive knowledge of the fast-moving consumer goods space to his role. Previously John spent 18 years at JP Morgan Chase where he was Managing Director, Equity Research, serving as the U.S. Beverages and Household Products/Personal Care Analyst. President, Europe
Jean-Luc Fischer became President, Europe in 2022. Previously, he served as President, North America Division, where he championed the acquisition of hello Products and drove organizational transformation to elevate North America’s innovation culture. His commitment to empowerment and experimentation inspired teamwork and optimism to produce exciting new products, including CO. by Colgate and hum. EVP & Deputy CLO, HR, Lit, Comp, NA Ops
Betsy Fishbone became Executive Vice President, Deputy Chief Legal Officer in 2025. . Since joining CP in 2001 as Human Resources Counsel, she has taken on increasing responsibility within the Company’s Global Legal Organization, including managing the Company's global litigation, compliance, competition law, data privacy and, most recently, overseeing the North America Division legal function. Over the course of her career, Betsy has become a trusted partner to the business, providing pragmatic advice and counsel to help the Company achieve its business goals in an ethical manner. Prior to working at CP, Betsy was an Associate at Morgan, Lewis & Bockius LLP, where she practiced Labor & Employment law. Chief Information Officer
David Foster became Colgate's Chief Information Officer in 2023, leading our Global Information Technology (GIT) strategy and continued digital transformation. David joined Colgate in 1996 and has held a number of leadership roles within the GIT organization. He has led Colgate's digital applications, developed new systems across many planning and execution processes, and created a number of new organizational capabilities, such as building a new Marketing IT organization, to partner with our Global Marketing and agency partners, driving growth for Colgate. David holds a Bachelor of Arts from Dartmouth College and an MBA from New York University.

EVP, Treasurer

Previously, Gina was Assistant Treasurer where she managed all capital markets activity and ensured efficient management of the company’s capital structure including issuance of the company’s inaugural Sustainability Bond and realization of significant interest expense savings through execution of liability management and interest rate derivative strategies. Chief Technology Officer

Prior to L'Oreal, Stephan worked at Unilever in the Research & Development division. Yvonne drove the business to achieve market share growth across both Hill’s Prescription Diet and Hill’s Science Diet in part by focusing on Disease Centricity and Passionate Advocacy. Yvonne joined Colgate-Palmolive in 2000 in Oral Care and progressed through a series of roles and categories within CP U.S. before moving to CP-South Pacific. She then joined Hill's U.S. in 2018. In addition, John oversaw the Global Corporate Communications and Global Security functions. Executive Vice President and Controller

Since joining the Company in 1993, Pablo has advanced through various roles of increasing responsibility including General Manager, CP-Adria in Europe Division and Vice President, Customer Development, CP-Mexico. Chief Human Resources Officer
In 2020, Sally Massey became Chief Human Resources Officer, leading all aspects of our Global Human Resources strategy and capabilities. Previously she guided a major HR transformation, leading Global People and Organization Development, Learning, Talent Acquisition, HR Operations and Total Rewards. Sally joined Colgate in 2000 as part of the Global Human Resources Professional Development Program and progressed through roles of increasing responsibility, advancing teams in the U.S., Supply Chain, Global Marketing & Customer Development, Latin America and Europe. Sally graduated from Bowdoin College and holds a Master of Management degree from Cornell University.

Ram Raghavan
President, Enterprise Oral Care
Ram Raghavan became President, Enterprise Oral Care (EOC) in 2022, leading the new EOC organization responsible for stewardship of our global oral care brands, setting the brand vision, strategy and developing core assets that deliver unified brand experiences across the Colgate world. Most recently, Ram was Vice President and General Manager, India & South Asia, where he provided strategic leadership to our India and South Asia businesses to power organic growth. Prior to this role, Ram was the Vice President Marketing in the Asia-Pacific Division. Ram joined C-P India in 1997 as a Management Trainee and has held roles in both Customer Development and Marketing in India and China. He was also Marketing Director for Canada and China and General Manager for the Latin America Consumer Innovation Center. Ram graduated from Narsee Monjee College of Commerce and Economics and holds an MBA from Jamnalal Bajaj Institute of Management Studies, both located in Mumbai, India.

Diana Schildhouse
Chief Data, Analytics & Insights Officer
Diana Schildhouse has been Chief Data, Analytics & Insights Officer since 2021, where she sets the vision, strategy and priorities for enterprise-wide data, analytics and insights at Colgate. Diana joined Colgate from Mattel where she was Senior Vice President and member of the Executive Leadership Team, leading Enterprise Strategy, Insights and Analytics. She built Mattel's first team of data scientists, advanced Mattel's data strategy, and pioneered large scale advanced analytics capabilities focused on marketing, media, new product development, customer and retail. With her team, she also led the development of enterprise-wide strategic planning for Mattel, with a focus on driving transformation, innovation and growth. Previously, Diana held the role of Senior Director of Strategy and Market Research for Westfield, a global shopping center developer. Diana began her career at The Walt Disney Company in corporate finance. Diana holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and B.S. in Business Administration from the University of Southern California.

Chief Supply Chain Officer
Luciano Sieber became Chief Supply Chain Officer in 2022, overseeing the entire Global Supply Chain team around the world, including manufacturing, sourcing and procurement. Luciano joined Colgate in 1995 as a Project Engineer, progressing through several roles within the Global Supply Chain function in Brazil, Latin America and Africa/Middle East Divisions, including Worldwide Director of Direct Procurement; Home Care Manufacturing Director in Europe; Demand Vice President, Europe & Africa/Eurasia; Supply Vice President, Europe & Africa/Eurasia; and Vice President, Global Supply & Global Supply Chain Reimagined Strategy. Most recently, he was the Vice President End-to-End for our North America Division. Luciano is a graduate of the Fundação Armando Alvares Penteado in Brazil.

Ann Tracy
Chief Sustainability Officer
Ann Tracy became Chief Sustainability Officer in the Global Commercial Organization in 2022, leading Colgate’s Global Sustainability Strategy and key initiatives, integrating a strong technical foundation across people, performance and planet into commercial strategic purpose. Previously, she was Global Chief Sustainability Officer in our Global Supply Chain Organization, where she also provided leadership to the Environmental, Health and Safety (EHS) team. Since joining the company in 1991, Ann has worked across all four of Colgate's categories in manufacturing, quality and customer service and logistics roles with experience in each of the Colgate divisions. Ann serves on the board of directors of the UN Global Compact Network USA and holds undergraduate degrees in Applied Science and Mechanical Engineering and a Master's of Engineering degree in Manufacturing Systems, all from Lehigh University. She has also received a Certificate of Sustainability from the University of Cambridge Institute for Sustainability Leadership.

History
The small soap and candle business that William Colgate began in New York City early in the 19th century is now, more than 200 years later, a truly global company serving hundreds of millions of consumers worldwide. Throughout this history, Colgate people and Colgate values have been at the heart of our success.
1806-1820
1806:
William Colgate starts a starch, soap and candle business on Dutch Street in New York City.
1817:
First Colgate advertisement appears in a New York newspaper.
1820:
Colgate establishes a starch factory in Jersey City, New Jersey.
1857-1866
1857:
Upon the death of founder William Colgate, the company is reorganized as Colgate & Company under the management of Samuel Colgate, our founder’s son.
1864:
B.J. Johnson opens a soap factory in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, which later becomes the Palmolive Company.
1866:
Colgate introduces perfumed soap and perfumes/essence.
1872-1879
1872:
Peet brothers establish a soap company in Kansas City, Kansas where they make Crystal White soap. Cashmere Bouquet, the first milled perfumed toilet soap, is registered as a Colgate trademark.
1873:
Colgate starts selling aromatic toothpaste in jars.
1879:
Gerhard Mennen establishes a pharmacy in Newark, New Jersey, which later becomes the Mennen Company.
1896-1898
1896:
Colgate introduces toothpaste in a collapsible tube.
1898:
B.J. Johnson Soap Co. introduces Palmolive Soap. Today, the Palmolive equity is sold in over 88 countries in 54 variants.
1900-1902
1900:
Colgate wins top honors for its fine soaps and perfumes at the World’s Fair in Paris.
1902:
Stylish Palmolive advertising begins, emphasizing ingredient purity and product benefits.
1906-1908
1906:
Colgate is incorporated by the five sons of Samuel Colgate. Ribbon opening is added to the Colgate tube: “We couldn’t improve the product, so we improved the tube.”
1908:
Colgate & Company celebrates its 100th anniversary. Our product line includes over 800 different products.
1911-1912
1911:
Colgate distributes two million tubes of toothpaste and toothbrushes to schools and hygienists to demonstrate tooth brushing.
1912:
William Mennen introduces the first American shaving cream tube.
1914-1920
1914:
Colgate establishes its first international subsidiary in Canada.
1920:
Colgate begins establishing operations in Europe, Asia, Latin America and Africa.
1926-1928
1926:
Soap manufacturers Palmolive and Peet merge to become Palmolive-Peet Company.
1928:
Colgate merges with Palmolive-Peet to become Colgate-Palmolive-Peet Company.
1930-1939
1930:
On March 13th, Colgate is first listed on the New York Stock Exchange.
1939:
Dr. Mark L. Morris develops a pet food to help save a guide dog named Buddy from kidney disease. This breakthrough leads to the first Hill’s Prescription Diet product.
1947-1953
1947:
Ajax cleanser is launched, establishing a powerful now-global brand equity for cleaning products.
1953:
Colgate-Palmolive Company becomes the company’s official name.
1956-1962
1956:
Colgate opens corporate headquarters at 300 Park Avenue in New York City.
1962:
Colgate opens research center in Piscataway, New Jersey.
1966-1968
1966:
Palmolive dishwashing liquid is introduced. Today, it is sold in over 35 countries.
1968:
Colgate toothpaste adds MFP Fluoride, clinically proven to reduce cavities.
1970-1972
1970:
Irish Spring launches in Germany as Irische Frühling and in Europe as Nordic Spring. In 1972, Irish Spring is introduced in North America.
1972:
Colgate acquires Hoyt Laboratories, which later becomes Colgate Oral Pharmaceuticals.
1975-1976
1975:
Caprice hair care launches in Mexico. Today, hair care products are sold in over 70 countries, with variants to suit every type of hair need.
1976:
Colgate-Palmolive acquires Hill’s Pet Nutrition. Today, Hill’s is the global leader in pet nutrition and veterinary recommendations.
1983-1985
1983:
Colgate Plus toothbrush is introduced. Today, over 2 billion Colgate toothbrushes are sold annually worldwide.
1985
: Protex bar soap is introduced, and today offers all-family antibacterial protection across the globe.
1986-1987
1986:
The Chairman’s You Can Make A Difference Program is launched, recognizing innovation and executional excellence by Colgate people.
1987:
Colgate acquires Softsoap liquid soap business from the Minnetonka Corporation. Today, Colgate is a global leader in liquid hand soap.
1989-1991
1989:
Annual Company sales surpass the $5 billion mark.
1991:
Colgate acquires Murphy Oil Soap, the leading wood cleaner in the United States. Today, its product portfolio has expanded to include all-purpose cleaners, sprays and wipes.
1992-1995
1992:
Colgate acquires the Mennen company, sold today across the globe. Colgate Total toothpaste is introduced.
1995:
Colgate enters Central Europe and Russia, expanding into fast-growing markets. Colgate acquires Kolynos Oral Care business in Latin America and launches market-leading Sorriso toothpaste.
1996-1997
1996:
Colgate® Bright Smiles, Bright Futures™ oral health education program expands to 50 countries, and today reaches over 50 million children annually.
1997:
Colgate Total toothpaste is introduced in the U.S. and quickly becomes the market leader. Colgate Total, with its 12-hour protection, fights a comprehensive range of oral health problems.
2004-2006
2004:
Colgate acquires the GABA oral care business in Europe, with its strength in the important European pharmacy channel and its ties with the dental community.
2006:
Colgate enters the fast-growing “Naturals” segment by purchasing Tom’s of Maine, a leader in that market in the United States.
2011-2013
2011:
Colgate acquires the Sanex personal care brand in Europe.
2013:
Hill’s enters the “Naturals” segment with the launch of Hill’s Ideal Balance™.
2014-2016
2014:
Colgate refurbishes the historic “Colgate Clock,” a landmark in Jersey City, New Jersey.
2016:
Colgate® Bright Smiles, Bright Futures™ celebrates 25 years of creating bright smiles. Since 1991, the program has reached more than 1.8 billion in 100 countries, with a goal or reaching 2 billion in 2025.
2017-2018
2017:
Colgate partners with the Mexican Dental Association Foundation to support passage of a new law requiring oral hygiene regimen during each school day for every child enrolled in a public primary school in Mexico City.
2018:
Colgate® Bright Smiles, Bright Futures™ celebrates 1 Billion children reached since 1991. Colgate acquires professional skin care brands PCA Skin and EltaMD, advancing Colgate’s presence in the premium global skin care category.
2019-2020
2019:
Colgate launches the first-of-its-kind recyclable toothpaste tube and acquires premium, anti-aging skin care brand Filorga. Colgate Total toothpaste and Hill’s Science Diet are relaunched.
2020:
Colgate acquires Hello Products LLC, and Colgate responds to COVID-19 pandemic by donating 25 million bars of #SafeHands soap along with $20 million in health and hygiene products and pet food.
Present
Colgate continues to focus on Oral Care, Personal Care, Home Care and Pet Nutrition and sells its products in over 200 countries and territories worldwide.

IMPACTO MEDIOAMBIENTAL
Nos comprometemos a reducir nuestro impacto medioambiental
Reconocemos el impacto que tenemos en el medioambiente y comprendemos la necesidad de proteger el planeta. Por eso nunca dejamos de buscar formas mejores y más sustentables de hacer nuestros productos y envases, lo que incluye la búsqueda de nuevas opciones que nos permitan usar menos plástico, además de producir la menor cantidad posible de desechos y educar a las personas sobre el ahorro de agua. Al fin y al cabo, un planeta saludable siempre es motivo para sonreír.
Uso de los recursos de forma responsable para un futuro mejor
NUESTROS OBJETIVOS DE SOSTENIBILIDAD
Sin envases problemáticos
Lograr que todos nuestros envases de plástico sean reciclables, reutilizables o compostables en 2025.
Cero emisiones de carbono
Lograr cero emisiones netas de carbono en 2040 y un 100 % de electricidad renovable para nuestras operaciones globales en 2030.
Instalaciones con residuos cero
Gestionar plantas de alta eficiencia, bajo impacto y residuos cero y lograr un 100 % de operaciones con residuos cero.
Edificios con consumo neutro de agua
Lograr un consumo neto cero de agua en nuestras plantas de fabricación situadas en zonas con escasez de agua para 2025 y en todas las plantas para 2030.

https://www.colgatepalmolive.com.co/contact-us

El resto de la línea Colgate Total Prevención Activa sigue disponible, así como todas las demás cremas dentales Colgate.

Sustainability
We are committed to building a more resilient future, and the promise of healthier communities energizes our sustainability efforts and our people.
Our Sustainability Strategy
Colgate-Palmolive is committed to a healthier future for all people, their pets and our planet. We're accelerating climate action, reducing our environmental footprint and collaborating to eliminate waste, decrease plastic use, save water and conserve resources. Our strategy focuses on three ambitions: Driving Social Impact, Helping Millions of Homes and Preserving Our Environment, as we reimagine a sustainable world.
Driving SocialImpact
We are committed to ensuring the well-being of all people and their pets, building an inclusive culture and creating meaningful opportunities for all people to succeed inside and outside of Colgate-Palmolive.
Helping Millions of Homes
We are empowering people and communities to develop healthier habits by choosing sustainable products that improve their lives and homes from oral and personal care to pet nutrition and home care.
Preserving Our Environment
We are
working to accelerate action on climate and reduce our environmental footprint
, working with our partners and operations to eliminate waste, decrease plastic usage, save water and conserve natural resources.
Impact in Action

of our packaging is recyclable, reusable or compostable, as of December 31, 2024, up from 89.5% the previous year.
~ 60%
In 2024, we signed a long-term virtual power purchase agreement for a wind farm in Europe, which is expected to cover the equivalent of approximately 60% of our Europe-based operational electricity needs.

Since 2019, we have transitioned approximately 75% of our toothpaste SKUs globally and about 95% of our toothpaste tubes in North America to recyclable tubes as of December 31, 2024. The recyclable tube is now accessible in over 70 countries worldwide.*
Innovating for a Sustainable Future
To support our efforts to reduce virgin plastic, we are introducing an innovative, recyclable paper-based package for our manual toothbrushes, transitioning away from traditional plastic packaging.
